author: kamennikolov
body:
### Summary of the new feature / enhancement

Our current release process is that we upload the new version of our PowerShell modules to the PowerShell gallery a few days before the GA date to test that everything uploads correctly. Then we try to download them from the gallery and import them to check that everything works fine and then we unlist them until the GA date. The problem is that with the number of modules getting bigger and bigger this manual updating of 50+ modules (with the perspective to become even more than this) becomes a serious bottleneck in this process. That's why we need an automated way to hide/unhide modules. 

### Proposed technical implementation details (optional)

_No response_

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body: This issue has been marked as external and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been be closed for housekeeping purposes.

title: We need an automated way to list/unlist module versions
